website_summaries.verdict: You can keep this chair around for a long time thanks to it being adjustable and having a high weight limit.
pros: Foot and seat plates are adjustable and weight limit is 250 pounds, so you can use this seat as a high chair up to a regular chair
Very sturdy and easy to assemble
Finished with a low VOC plant-based lacquer
cons: The back legs stick out a little, which can make them a tripping hazard depending on the placement of the chair

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any parent of young children.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair for my 6 year old and absolutely love it. He is able to sit still at the table now because the foot rest allows him to be more comfortable. He doesn't make a mess with his food because he is sitting at the exact right height for him. I only wish I would have bought it as soon as he grew out of his high chair! There are so many height options that I can tell we are still going to get many more years of use out of this chair.
customer_reviews.author: cori

customer_reviews.title: Design changed--used to be a 5 star product
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 of these, one for each kid. We loved the first two, but were very disappointed when the 3rd one came with one less slot available, exactly where we wanted to put the seat for our 16 month old. We got our oldest to trade chairs, so it worked out for us, but I wouldn't recommend this seat for a young toddler anymore.
customer_reviews.author: L. Genne

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: The design has changed since I got the chair 2 years ago. My husband had to make some adjustments - take some parts from old chair. This chair is intended for kids over 3 years old, but my 2 years old doesn't use straps for more than 6 months already. They put screws to hold straps so you cannot take them off to wash. The seat part is lower now too - there's no slot for higher position of the seat. Update: the bottom of the leg cracked - poor quality plywood.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Good chair, delivered damaged twice
customer_reviews.text: Beatiful sturdy chair. Our 2.5yo can climb on it independently and sits secure. Quality of the wood is disappointing, though. First chair had a broken belt closure and pressure on the package pressed the plastic closure into the wood leaving an ugly dent. Ordered replacement which came with an even deeper dent in exact same spot! See picture, I put the parts of first and second delivery next to each other. Further, the backrest has some ugly cracks in the wood, just on surface though. Chair is very sturdy. Otherwise it's a nice chair and we're enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Ilja Kusters

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to help my 20 month old grandson, who is off the charts for height, sit comfortably at the dining table with his parents. It was an early birthday present! It had made his eating times less stressful. I like the fact that it can change and grow along with him, and it’s sturdy enough that when he outgrows it, it can be passed along in the family.
customer_reviews.author: Mari Fran

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy with simple assembly
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a similar chair a couple years ago and needed a second. This one was easier to assemble and is sturdier once assembled. It adjusts with a couple hex bolts in no time at all. It does not have straps for over the shoulder so probably not for real little kids but I like the seatbelt buckle on this model too.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: A chair of their own.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the height of seat and foot rest are adjustable. I like that there is a small harness to discourage kid from twisting around. Pro and Con of nice smooth wood surface is that it's easy to wipe off (necessary with messy toddler) but it promotes tush-wiggling and twisting. slippery surface is too fun and makes them want to move around. I would recommend this chair though. We bought it for our just-turned-3 year old. He is capable of climbing up/down on his own which is what we wanted.
customer_reviews.author: KBY

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this.  Totally worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Mealtimes are so much better now that we have this chair. My four year is as tall as a six year old but still has this chair at its highest setting. He loves the height for meals and I love that he can't bounce in and out of this like he was doing on a regular dining chair. He does not think this is a "baby chair" at all. Attractive and looks/feels like real furniture, not cheap crap, because it IS real furniture. I have an injured hand and always worry about assembly but this was a breeze. I initially hesitated because of the price but now I'm so glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Barsoap

customer_reviews.title: Love our keekaroos
customer_reviews.text: This is our second keekaroo chair. Our 3 year old loves his so much that he didn't want to give it up so we bought a second for our 1 year old. The first one we bought came with the tray so we swapped the seats out so our younger son could use the tray. I would buy the one with the tray for kids younger than 18-24 months. I think the recommended age is 3 but my son used it shown at 2 with no issues. He can now climb up and down and we don't have to strap him in anymore. We love our chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea B.

customer_reviews.title: Great chair to encourage proper posture and alignment
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 for my children, 7 and 10, and they use them every day!!! I use my son's because it fits me as well and I usually choose it over our regular chairs when I can. Truly a comfortable chair and I am so glad I purchased. pretty easy to put together and totally for the money for my children ( especially my 7 yo). My daughter can now sit properly at the table and have good posture!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Colunga

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, and very nice looking
customer_reviews.text: This chair is well-made, sturdy, and very nice looking. We have two of them, and I love that the kids can climb in and out of them easily, as opposed to a regular high chair. My kids actually enjoy buckling themselves into these chairs. They also very much like pushing themselves back from the table when they are done eating, and these chairs have never even begun to tip over. They are very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great chair to grow with your child
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for our two year old and ordered a second for our jealous five year old! They both love their chairs! They sit better at meal time, which makes this chair worth every penny! Love that it grows with them! Strong enough to support adult weight, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jer H

customer_reviews.title: great therapy chair
customer_reviews.text: We bought one for using with our prek kids for speech therapy. We loved it so much... we bought another one for the other therapist! Amazing how much this helps keep therapy session in control. Very sturdy, high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany C

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great chair. Durable. Sturdy. Gives my child the sense of being with us at the table but can still strap him in :) I do think it’s a little pricey though.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: We love the chair. My daughter loves being at the dining room table with us. The pad purchased separately did nothing for us. Always falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Buglady

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Grandson loves this. Easy to get on and off. Put a small, nonslip cushion on the seat for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Nia

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler/preschool chair
customer_reviews.text: Great kids chair. My 2.5 year old loves to get herself in and out of it. We will use this for years. Love the non-scratch skids on bottom to keep our wood floors in good condition. Quality wood and materials.
customer_reviews.author: Charleen

customer_reviews.title: Love this chair.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toddler chair that will adjust as my granddaughter grows. It is a beautiful mahogany color wooden piece of furniture. We are extremely happy with it. However a simple cushion for the seat would be nice to include. I found the chair easy to assemble (I am a 65 yr old grandma).
customer_reviews.author: JOANN

customer_reviews.title: Great and sturdy chairs, but 21 month old can unbuckle herself
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these chairs for our 5 year old and our 21 month old. They have been using the chairs for about one year and love them. The chairs are very sturdy, easy to adjust and I love how they griw with your kid. I am taking one star off as my 21 month old just started the buckles by herself without any problem. These buckles should be tough enough that no kud under the age of 2 opens them easily.
customer_reviews.author: Francesco G.

customer_reviews.title: Necessary for a Toddler
customer_reviews.text: One of the best investments I’ve done for my toddler. She outgrew her high chair and this allows her to sit with us at the table and not feel left out. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Mayoral

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile investment
customer_reviews.text: Very nice piece of furniture that grows with the babies.
customer_reviews.author: Baby Varga

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, sturdy, and functional
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we got. We liked it so much for our first child, so it was an easy decision to get a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Arik D

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the big holes on the back part because an ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes quite some time to put together but my 2year old loves sitting in it.he can climb up and down by himself and it feels very stable. I don't like the big holes on the back part because an arm could get stuck in the bigger hole,maybe she nothing to consider
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chair. We use it for our 5 year ...
customer_reviews.text: Great chair. We use it for our 5 year old to sit at the counter (higher than a table). With the keekaroo cushions at the highest position it is just the right hight and the platform for the feet makes a huge difference for wiggly kids :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very well built
customer_reviews.text: Great transition away from the baby chair. It looks grownup. It's very sturdy and is built to last through a lot of use. Smooth enough to be easily cleaned. Adjustable enough to last for several years of growth. We got it so that we could still have a safety strap, but not a baby chair.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Grider

customer_reviews.title: looks very nice and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: looks very nice and very sturdy. Love that it is adjustable and a perfect transition seat from high chair to eating with family at the table (like a big kid). highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: L. Lorenz

customer_reviews.title: Good High Chair
customer_reviews.text: Great high chair, I researched quite a bit before I bought it. Sometimes the buckle is a little difficult on ours for some reason, and my son likes to stick his arm through the hole in the back. Other than that its a great high chair.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Great for saving space
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our kiddo! Saves space and he loves sitting at the table with the rest of us. It looks nice with our wooden dining table.
customer_reviews.author: E. Snee

customer_reviews.title: Great chair but the bolts keep coming loose and for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great chair but the bolts keep coming loose and for a 60 lb 7 year old, I have to keep checking the bolts to make sure they are tight!!
customer_reviews.author: julie johnson

customer_reviews.title: Another excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing better than having no idea what to order, following a well reviewed product, and totally agreeing with the other reviewers that this is an excellent chair. Cleans up easily, and it holds our toddler in safely. Plus he has room to grow with the chair being adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Dsmack10

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sturdy chair and looks great. I love how it's so easy to clean. The only problems I have had is that if I don't strap the child in they can wriggle out the back for fun or stand up in the chair. Also, I am constantly jamming my toe on it because if it's wide base. Make sure to check the measurements of your table with the chair height to make sure it will fit under the stable. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JangoFett

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Its perfect for my 2 year old who transitioned out of a high chair! My only regret is not getting it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Leo

customer_reviews.title: This chair is not only nice to look at
customer_reviews.text: This chair is not only nice to look at, but totally useful and perfect for our toddler and his growth. Love this, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Daniela C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Match
customer_reviews.text: Magnificent design very sturdy. Beautiful packaging and easy install. Very happy to have this.
customer_reviews.author: momighty

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect. I usually catch my son
customer_reviews.text: What a hit! My 3 year old daughter loves her new chair! She is extra tiny for her age but didn't want to be in a booster seat any more. This is perfect. I usually catch my son, husband and father sitting in the chair when my daughter is not around! Everyone loves it!
customer_reviews.author: G. S.

customer_reviews.title: Love this chair
customer_reviews.text: My son uses these chairs in OT and loves them - so I bought one for home and we love it!
customer_reviews.author: ssims

customer_reviews.title: Broke easily
customer_reviews.text: Aesthetically pleasing, like the height adjustment. Ours broke after just 4 months of use. Plenty expensive for it to not last.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Bitker

customer_reviews.title: Game-changer for meals in our household. My kid was ...
customer_reviews.text: Game-changer for meals in our household. My kid was pushing out of his booster and refused the highchair. This chair is the BOMB.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica G. Gladstone

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It was a little expensive, but we really love it. It looks nice in the room and the wood is sold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great quality and definitely a more affordable alternative to the ...
customer_reviews.text: great quality and definitely a more affordable alternative to the stokke tripp trapp! I might even like this one better....
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: good chair for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Our son had outgrown the chair that attached to the table, so we needed something beyond a highchair but not a booster. He loves this chair and we love it too. It was easy to assemble (my almost 2-year old helped!) and he love to sit in it. It is sturdy and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper of good things

customer_reviews.title: Excellent high-chair!
customer_reviews.text: I loved it so much, I bought a second one just like it for my baby. Now both my toddler and little baby sit in these high-chairs and we just love them!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Meighan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Spent a lot of time contemplating this or the more expensive Stokke version - after 3 months - I'm glad we didnt spend the extra money. This has worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great ! My little one with low muscle tone love it ! Foot rest is the best . We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: Best money I spent on a baby product. My son LOVE to be at the table with us. He sits proudly. Chair is sturdy, wasn't difficult to put together and hasn't tipped when my older one attempts to climb.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfTwo

customer_reviews.title: Good product, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair when my son is around 2 and now he's more than 4 but we still use it now. He height is adjustable and makes him feel so comfortable. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ht05

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart! Buy the Stokke instead
customer_reviews.text: The chair collapsed after three weeks of completely normal and customary usage by my 4 yr old son. The seat and footrest slid right out, highly dangerous. Even when I retightened the screws the same issue kept occurring. Just bit the bullet and purchased the Stocks Trip Trapp. Feels WAY more solid and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob J Weinstein

customer_reviews.title: Best high chair!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of this high chair. I love these. It's better than stokke tripp trapp.
customer_reviews.author: Jimin Lee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: looks great at my table, child cannot tip it over by pushing back on the table
customer_reviews.author: Bea

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this chair. It's easy to clean and wipe down. We got the one with the cushion seat and tray. The tray is wonderful, I like that there is a removable plastic covering so they eat on that most days. The cushion is okay. I wish it was washable. My son urinated on it and we had to take it off, so now he is cushionless. It seems silly to me to make a kids product - a kids food product - that isn't washable! Also, I keep hitting my toes on the frame because, no matter how many times I look, I forget the bottom comes out a little in the back!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for our children
customer_reviews.text: Great chair for our children. Easy to assemble. I would recomend this chair as it is adjusting as child grows
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Think the price is unnecessary.
customer_reviews.text: 4 for color match and practicality. 27 lb. very small 5 year old can fully get up and down, not tippy for us, solid. Think the price is unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but the pieces don't fit together as well ...
customer_reviews.text: Good, but the pieces don't fit together as well as the did on the one we bought for my first child a few years ago
customer_reviews.author: buildingwithrainbows

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Awesome high chair, worth the price, easy to clean, simple, sturdy, well made. Nothing to mess with, perfect.
customer_reviews.author: LadyBug0237

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair
customer_reviews.text: Great chair for little children but do not buy the cushion set to go with it. The cushions will not stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Freckles

customer_reviews.title: Even my 8 year old nephew prefers to sit in this chair-it's everyone's favorite. Also
customer_reviews.text: Purchasing a second one for our second child because the older one doesn't want to give it up. Even my 8 year old nephew prefers to sit in this chair-it's everyone's favorite. Also, cleans well. It's been spilled upon and drawn on and wipes up really well. Good quality with over a year's use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this chair. so happy with this purchase. easy to put together too
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Ho

customer_reviews.title: Fine, pricey, no silver bullet.
customer_reviews.text: A pretty good chair, tho hasn't ameliorated my son's wiggliness at mealtimes as well as I'd hoped. Pretty pricey for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the chair and it really hold adults as well !
customer_reviews.author: Paula Cutts

customer_reviews.title: supportive, sturdy and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old is too big for a high chair or booster but needs the core support of a special chair at the table. The is sturdy, easy to assemble and cheaper than similar products. It offers the back and foot support my child requires and gives her stability so she can eat and play comfortably at the table. She is finally using her core to sit up straight rather than clamshelling into a curved seat designed for babies.
customer_reviews.author: mped

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very safe and beatuful. My daughter learnt how to go up by herself with 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: Marina B

customer_reviews.title: Keekaroo beats Stokke
customer_reviews.text: So much better to spend the money here vs. Stokke. I have two. My parents thought they were so great, they bought two for their own house. The wood is solid and looks really nice. We got the back support and seat as well and are happy with those. Clean up is easy. My only beef with these is that everyone has tripped over the back legs. The stylish, kickstand style of the legs, leaves them jutting out a bit. But still would recommend with enthusiasm.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago_Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great investment.
customer_reviews.text: I had one for my kids when they were younger and now I bought one for my grandchildren. The other one lasted 30 years. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Breazeale

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just good as expected! Recommend for families with toddlers from 3 years old and up.
customer_reviews.author: Chiapi

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Great value for this wooden adjustable high chair. We use ours constantly, and mom and dad sit on it all the time when we're at the table doing projects. It's great to have a high chair we can also use and it doesn't just take up space when it's not being used for the kidlet. Great price compared to the other adjustable wooden high chair on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Ward

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I have a stokke tripp trapp as well and just couldn't drop that kind of money for a second chair. This chair is way more sturdy than the stokke. I love the design. The only thing that I don't like is that they don't offer cloth seating pads for this chair like Stokke. I prefer to buy a few to change out the look and the pads are super expensive! I was a bit fearful that my daredevil child would fall out of this chair but he hasn't yet. He climbs into and out of it himself and it is very sturdy. LOVE IT! Don't waste your money on a Stokke!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This chair is great. My son is 3/half
customer_reviews.text: This chair is great. My son is 3/half. He has no problem getting up & down with this chair. My only complaint was with shipping. Some of the wood was scraped on the seat & foot boards. But it's sturdy & easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Janan Noland

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but it's worth the price. Very sturdy - I sometime use it a stepping stool and I weight 185 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Han Solo

customer_reviews.title: Great high chair~
customer_reviews.text: I really love this chair - it's got a great price point and when compared to Stokke or the other wooden brands, it's just as nice! It was super easy to put together, and the mahogany color is nice. Gave it 4 stars because the wood chips easily, though.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa B. Urszinyi

customer_reviews.title: Keekaroo Adjustable High Chair
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift and my son and daughter in law are very pleased. It has such a sleek look and so much more attractive than the traditional high chair. The fact that is can be used by adults as well makes so much more sense.
customer_reviews.author: Brodie

customer_reviews.title: Next step
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement from our high chair. Our son is now three, and ready sit at the table fully. Additionally it looks great with our dining room set.
customer_reviews.author: Darin Henderson

customer_reviews.title: New Granny!
customer_reviews.text: Our son got one for his son and it was a huge hit. He,would not longer get in his highchair or a booster seat. So we purchased one for our house when they visit!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for alternatives for our booster seat as our 2 year old had been refusing to use it- making dinner time trying. She loves her new "big girl chair" and it's the perfect size for her. Can use it to pull up to the counter when she wants to "help" with the cooking.
customer_reviews.author: SRK

customer_reviews.title: I love this high chair
customer_reviews.text: I love this high chair! It's so cute and nice to be able to wipe off food without getting stuck in crevices! I hate that with high chairs. I had to contact keekaroo for the tray and seat though because they wouldn't sell it by itself (the tray) for safety reasons. They were really nice and helpful and the shipping was fast. I'm a fan!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Rosinski

customer_reviews.title: it's o. k but deceiving because suppose to be ...
customer_reviews.text: it's o.k but deceiving because suppose to be new and you can see some default that were corrected. :-( and my husband had to drill a hole that was not done correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Anik Matte

customer_reviews.title: highchair did not come with proper screws
customer_reviews.text: one of the screws didn't fit and the directions were not suffecient to fix the problem. We had order the part, but it did not get here in time for our granddaughter's birthday. We very disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: mary Migliaccio

customer_reviews.title: great Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: our 2 year old grandson loves to sit in his chair at the dinner table. This chair will work for him clear until he reaches adulthood.
customer_reviews.author: Jovita Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Love this chair
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair!! Have special needs grand child and it works great for her. Bought a second one for cabin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The most awesome high chair. Now he will sit in it. Easy to put together and at the right height for the table. He can climb up himself. Gives him the independence while keeping him safe.
customer_reviews.author: Mum of 2

customer_reviews.title: practical chair
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to assemble. I found them also to be very sturdy for both kids and adults. I am able to keep them (2) in my formal dining room which are very compatible with my furniture. My granddaughters also find them very comfortable. These are almost impossible to overturn. I would highly recommend and plan on using them for any future grandchildren. You can order accessories such as padding for seats and back as well as a tray for little ones.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Good one
customer_reviews.text: Very good chair. My 3 year kid is very happy using it. The only complain I have it is a little slippery. So be careful if your child does not have a sit belt on.
customer_reviews.author: Deyanira

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, attractive ,and durable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Keekaroo. We loved our first one so much that we didn't want to take it away from our 4 year old, so we purchased a new one for our baby. Easy to adjust and looks like grown-up furniture, not baby furniture.
customer_reviews.author: AKG8tr

customer_reviews.title: Great chair, a few issues
customer_reviews.text: As others said this is a great chair but there are a few issues: 1. Kids sit up high and there is no step for them to climb up to the seat. 2. The nuts get loose easily. Make sure you check it every now and then and tighten them if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Kazuki

customer_reviews.title: Great chair! But had to exchange for the toddler ...
customer_reviews.text: Great chair! But had to exchange for the toddler chair without the tray , grandson too big As soon as I droped of ar ups within one day I got my credit.
customer_reviews.author: Magge Childress

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddler
customer_reviews.text: I needed something sturdy for our 3 year old to climb on and off on her own. It works great, wouldn't tip over even when she climbs on it from back. A little smaller than I expected, I made a thick cushion - my daughter is shorty and can't easily reach counter without a cushion..
customer_reviews.author: OlgaB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect child's chair.
customer_reviews.text: This is well made and very stable. The adjustable seat and foot rest make it a perfect chair for a child.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy assembly, easy to adjust, and looks great. My 2 year old is very comfortable in it. You would definitely need the infant seat insert for younger children though. It doesn't take up any more space than a regular adult chair which is a huge plus. The safety belt isn't of the greatest quality but it keeps our daughter in the chair just fine. Very happy with this purchase overall.
customer_reviews.author: Eve738

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: I know someone who has the Stokke Tripp Trapp chair. And, I own the Keekaroo chair. Here is my comparison of the two in a nutshell. With its cross-bracing, the Keekaroo chair seems much more sturdy. Otherwise, the chairs seem pretty much identical. I don't think the Stokke chair is worth $100 more.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Just what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a great high chair. It is easy to set up and easy to clean! I accidentally ordered the chair without the tray, so unfortunately had to order the tray seperately.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Nice Chair!!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together and good design. I bought this chair for my son that is 3 years old and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: okay but after two years looks cheap
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of these chairs but they have not held up very well. I have had it for two years now and my kids have scraped off the dark coating finish in many places. It is light underneath and just makes it look cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great kids chair
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy chair for growing children. Great progression from high chair to toddler to child and beyond. Easy to assemble, looks great.
customer_reviews.author: wendy bean

customer_reviews.title: Highchair
customer_reviews.text: This works great the only reason it did not receive five stars is it does not fold up great product
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: great lead time and quality
customer_reviews.text: the chair got a great quality but the only disadvantage is that you need something for the sitting compfort!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ginal

product_meta.title: Keekaroo Height Right Kids High Chair, Mahogany
product_meta.description:
Color:MahoganyYou can’t outgrow the Keekaroo Kids Chair. From 6 months to 250 lbs, the Kids Chair is your stylish seating solution. Made of Rubberwood, the wooden high chair is durable and will last the test of time and the messiest eaters. As your child grows, the seat and foot plates can be adjusted to create the perfect seat. The foot plate can turn into a seat plate when your child’s feet touch the ground. The Kids Chair can be your child’s chair at the dinner table, at the computer or anywhere. Keekaroo keeps safety in mind. The Keekaroo Kids Chair is made with a plant based lacquerer finish. It is JPMA certified to the highest ASTM standards for the safety of your child. Features included in the Kids Chair are the depth adjustable seat and footplate, height adjustable seat and foot plate and 3-point positioning belt. The ergonomic design of the backrest allows for a comfortable seating position. If more comfort is required, Comfort Cushions can be added. Available in a variety of colors for the most comfortable seat in the house. Comfort Cushions are made in the USA and are made from a BPA and Latex-Free peel and tear resistant material that offers anti-microbial protection. Comfort Cushions wipe clean with warm water and are impermeable to liquids. Keekaroo is style, function and affordability.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER

The ergonomic design of the backrest allows for a comfortable seating position. If more comfort is required, Comfort Cushions can be added. Available in a variety of colors for the most comfortable seat in the house. Comfort Cushions wipe clean with warm water and are impermeable to liquids. Keekaroo is style, function and affordability.
